hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Breakout on 3-Day Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and BTC consolidates within a 3% range for 3 consecutive days, a breakout above the consolidation high with >1.5x average volume will signal a transition to a BULL regime, generating a positive 5-day forward return.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended consolidation in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. High-volume breakouts from tight ranges have historically signaled regime transitions as institutional capital enters.
entry_conditions: BTC 3-day price range (high-low) < 3% of current price
Breakout day volume > 150% of 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 days after entry OR 15% gain, whichever comes first

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain (price returns to consolidation range within 2 days) OR forward 5-day return is negative > 60% of occurrences.
